events.message: The policyholder reported an accident involving their vehicle colliding with a roadside barrier. Initial details of the incident were submitted.
This claim was officially categorized under Auto Accident due to the involvement of the insured car and reported collision.
An agent has been assigned to handle the case promptly to ensure timely processing of the vehicle collision claim.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed the next steps for the claimant to follow.
Requested photographs of the damaged vehicle and police report to support the investigation of the auto accident claim.
The claimant has submitted the required documents including images of the vehicle and the official police accident report.
Investigation has commenced with an assigned adjuster reviewing the submitted evidence and details surrounding the vehicle collision.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and damage was as described in the submitted documents.
A settlement amount covering the repair costs of the damaged vehicle has been proposed to the claimant for approval.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling and clarity of the settlement proposal offered by the insurer.
The insurance company formally approved the claim and authorized payment based on the agreed settlement terms.
Payment for the approved settlement was issued to the claimantâ€™s bank account as compensation for the vehicle repairs.
The claim was officially closed following successful settlement and payment confirming completion of all required procedures.
The claim files and related documents have been archived for record-keeping purposes in accordance with company policies.
